title.narrative: Apoyo a la Competitividad
Support for Competitiveness

description.narrative: EL Banco y el Gobierno de Guyana han acordado estructurar una operacion hibrida consistente en: 1) un prestamo basado en politicas para mejorar el clima para la inversion privado; 2) un programa de inversiones para apoyar la implantacion de las medidas del prestamo basado en politicas e inversiones menores prioritarias. Los posibles componentes del prestamo basado en politicas incluyen: 1) Clima para la Inversion Privada; 2) Desarrollo Empresarial 3) Desarrollo de Conglomerados; and 4) Cooperacion para la Competitividad.

The program will contribute to the sustainable development of productive economic activities through policy measures to improve the economic and institutional environment for private sector development.

activity-description.narrative: 14 small businesses benefitted from grants totalling over US$300,000
8th Meeting of NCC conducted

An investment attraction and export promotion system was implemented with indicative investment attraction and export targets to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of GOINVEST's role of investment promotion, facilitation, image building and export promotion.
Businesses in Guyana have benefiitted from improved business registration procedures that would result in speedier incorporation.
GNBS officers are now trained and registered as internationally recognized ISO 9001 auditors.
Government, private sector and labour meet to discuss issues important to enhancing Guyana's competitiveness. Policy decisions are also made at these meetings.
Improved legislation will result in greater protection for businesses (Competition Legislation) and consumers (Consumer Legislation) in Guyana.
Legislation for the Credit Bureau was completed to legitimize the creation of private entities authorized to secure credit information on individuals and make this available to potential creditors.
Monitoring & Evaluation System developed and implemented for NCSU
Small Business Council instituted with a membership of 11 and the CEO of the Small Business Bureau totalling 12. The SBC meets monthly.
Small and Medium Enterprises’ (SMEs) will be able to access the global market.

The Government of Guyana benfitted from a US$10,000,000 budgetary support targetted at the implementation of policy conditions that would enhance Guyana's competitiveness and contribute to the increase in private investment and export development.

The Government of Guyana benfitted from a US$3,000,000 budgetary support targetted at the implementation of policy conditions that would enhance Guyana's competitiveness and contribute to the increase in private investment and export development.

The Government of Guyana benfitted from a US$5,000,000 budgetary support targetted at the implementation of policy conditions that would enhance Guyana's competitiveness and contribute to the increase in private investment and export development.
The Program has supported a new private-public institutional framework for the implementation of the National Competitiveness Strategy.
The Program has supported the implementation of a strategic plan to strengthen the GNBS, train staff and finance equipment upgrades.
The Program supported the drafting of policy proposals and legislations critical to improving the business environment for private sector development.

The Program supported the preparation of a tax study and an action plan to enhance Guyana's attractiveness to investors through a business friendly tax structure that does not compromise Government's revenue.
The Program supported the simplification of export and import procedures.
The Strategic Plan will provide institutional strengthening to the GNBS and the work they undertake to do based on their mandate
The Unit provides support to the National Competitiveness Council which is the highest public-private decision making body that is chaired by the President
The business plan for GOINVEST was completed to improve its effectiveness and efficiency and to fulfill its expanded role of investment promotion, facilitation, image building and export promotion.
The implementation of the communications strategy for the Guyana National Bureau of Standards provides a framework from which the Bureau can communicate with its clients and the general public.
The program has supported the simplification of export and import procedures aimed at improving investment attraction, export promotion and raising production standards.
The program supported the drafting and implementation of a new legal framework to create a Credit Bureau.
The project has provided support to strengthen and modernize the Deeds Registry in order to streamline business registration and incorporation procedures.
The project supported the implementation of Trade Point Guyana at GOINVEST to facilitate foreign trade and investment.
The project supported the upgrading of investment attraction and export promotion systems.
